intro: Sinclairiopsis klattii, commonly known as the Klatt's sinclairiopsis, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves that are typically arranged in a whorled pattern. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, a feature common to many members of its family. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sinclairiopsis klattii is considered a species of conservation concern.
